snippet.title: Airport delays on way to Townsville
snippet.content: PASSENGERS travelling through major airports en route to Townsville should expect delays. Townsville Airport has moved to reassure passengers it is not impacted by additional aviation security measures put in place after terrorist threats. But the airport did warn passengers travelling through any of the affected airports en route back to Townsville would be subject to increased processing times. "(Passengers) are encouraged to arrive at the airport two hours before scheduled flight," a Townsville Airport spokesman said. "There are no changes to what may be carried on board an aircraft and more information can be found at www.travelsecure.infrastructure.gov.au." "The new measures, which affect international and domestic terminals at Australia's major airports, do not include Townsville Airport. "The introduction is applicable to Australian capital city airports only, with the inclusion of both Gold Coast and Cairns airports. "Townsville Airport security screening procedures remain unchanged as directed by the Australian Government." The new measures were brought in after a .
